titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يُجْزِئُ مِنَ الْعُمْرَةِ الْمَفْرُوضَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 205 – What suffices from the Obligatory Umra

titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يُسْتَحَبُّ مِنَ الصَّدَقَةِ عِنْدَ الْخُرُوجِ مِنْ مَكَّةَ
titles.en: Chapter 204 – What is recommended from the charity during the exit from Makkah

titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يُجْزِئُ مِنَ الْعُمْرَةِ الْمَفْرُوضَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 205 – What suffices from the Obligatory Umra

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/232)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا اسْتَمْتَعَ الرَّجُلُ بِالْعُمْرَةِ فَقَدْ قَضَى مَا عَلَيْهِ مِنْ فَرِيضَةِ الْعُمْرَةِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘When a man performs Tumatto with the Umra, so he has fulfilled whatever was upon him, from the Obligatory Umra’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “Abu `Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that if one performs al-‘Umrah in al-Tamattu £ form, he has completed the obligatory acts of an obligatory al- £ Umrah.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/232)

parts.text: أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْعُمْرَةِ أَ وَاجِبَةٌ هِيَ قَالَ نَعَمْ قُلْتُ فَمَنْ تَمَتَّعَ يُجْزِئُ عَنْهُ قَالَ نَعَمْ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companins, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Abu Nasr who said,
‘I asked Abu Al-Hassanasws about the Umra, ‘Is it Obligatory?’ Heasws said: ‘Yes’. I said, ‘So the one who performs Tumatto, would it suffice him from it?’ Heasws said: ‘Yes’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn abu Nasr who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about al- £ Umrah; if it is obligatory. He (the Imam) said, £ Yes, it is obligatory.’ I then asked, ‘If one is for al-Tamattu £ (advantageous) is it sufficient?’ He (the Imam) said, £ Yes, it is sufficient.’” (Fatwa best explains Hadith 2 of this Chapter)
